titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the William Sturgis Thomas Papers
1892-1935
MS 622
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:45 -0400.

did.abstract:
Thomas's correspondence, including letters received and carbon copies of letters sent. The collection includes many letters from Thomas's children, relatives, friends and acquaintances, other doctors, and patients. They pertain to his work as a physician, more particularly as an allergist; his association with St. Luke's Hospital; his interest in genealogy; the authorship of "A Visit from St. Nicholas"; his research for, and publication of his Field book of common mushrooms; a few letters about his service during World War I; membership in numerous historical, medical, and religious organizations; and his interest in the flute.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: William Sturgis Thomas papers
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.
